items.title: Ask HN: Do you find AI code review tools useful?
items.raw_excerpt: I'm struggling to understand how these tools are actually useful. The AI doesn't have the product knowledge to catch logic bugs, and basic tests should eliminate syntactic bugs/endless loops etc. Perhaps codebase indexing could help, although it still wouldn't be able to understand the "why" behind the code. Curious if others feel the same

title_i18n.en: Ask HN: Do you find AI code review tools useful?
title_i18n.zh: 问HN：你觉得AI代码审查工具有用吗？
title_i18n.es: Pregunta HN: ¿Encuentras útiles las herramientas de revisión de código con IA?

excerpt_i18n.en: I'm struggling to understand how these tools are actually useful. The AI doesn't have the product knowledge to catch logic bugs, and basic tests should eliminate syntactic bugs/endless loops etc. Perhaps codebase indexing could help, although it still wouldn't be able to understand the "why" behind the code. Curious if others feel the same
excerpt_i18n.zh: 我难以理解这些工具的实际用处。AI缺乏产品知识来捕捉逻辑错误，而基础测试本应能消除语法错误和无限循环等问题。或许代码库索引能解决部分问题。
excerpt_i18n.es: Me cuesta entender cómo estas herramientas son realmente útiles. La IA no tiene el conocimiento del producto para detectar errores de lógica, y las pruebas básicas deberían eliminar errores sintácticos/bucles infinitos, etc. Quizás la indexación de la base de código...

items.title: Ask HN: Share a video-series of developing non-trivial things with AI?
items.raw_excerpt: I often see claims like "Ya, AI was rather bad at developing features ~6 months ago, but now it's _actually_ good!". Every once in a while I go and try using it for more significant development work, but thus far I've been disappointed. Thus far for me, it's been great for brainstorming or making initial prototypes, but generally not good enough to ship a finished artifact that has to interact with other pieces. I don't want to waste time doing this test again. And maybe I'm just doing it wrong. If there is a video series of somebody using AI to develop something rather complex, I think that would be much better evidence than the usual unsupported claim, and it could show me what I'm doing wrong. I'm imagining this would be like a "Let's play" series, but for software development. If no su

title_i18n.en: Ask HN: Share a video-series of developing non-trivial things with AI?
title_i18n.zh: HN提问：分享用AI开发复杂项目的视频系列？
title_i18n.es: Pregunta en HN: ¿Compartís una serie de vídeos sobre desarrollar cosas no triviales con IA?

excerpt_i18n.en: I often see claims like "Ya, AI was rather bad at developing features ~6 months ago, but now it's _actually_ good!". Every once in a while I go and try using it for more significant development work, but thus far I've been disappointed. Thus far for me, it's been great for brainstorming or making initial prototypes, but generally not good enough to ship a finished artifact that has to interact with other pieces. I don't want to waste time doing this test again. And maybe I'm just doing it wrong. If there is a video series of somebody using AI to develop something rather complex, I think that would be much better evidence than the usual unsupported claim, and it could show me what I'm doing wrong. I'm imagining this would be like a "Let's play" series, but for software development. If no su
excerpt_i18n.zh: 我经常看到类似说法："半年前AI开发功能确实不太行，但现在真的变厉害了！"。每隔一段时间我都会尝试用它完成更重要的开发任务，但迄今为止仍不尽如人意。
excerpt_i18n.es: A menudo veo afirmaciones como "Sí, la IA era bastante mala desarrollando funciones hace unos 6 meses, ¡pero ahora es realmente buena!". De vez en cuando intento usarla para trabajos de desarrollo más significativos, pero hasta ahora he

items.title: OpenAI Teams Up With Oracle and SoftBank to Build 5 New Stargate Data Centers
items.raw_excerpt: The new sites will boost Stargate’s planned capacity to nearly 7 gigawatts—about equal to the output of seven large nuclear reactors.

title_i18n.en: OpenAI Teams Up With Oracle and SoftBank to Build 5 New Stargate Data Centers
title_i18n.zh: OpenAI与甲骨文和软银合作建设五座新型星际之门数据中心。
title_i18n.es: OpenAI se asocia con Oracle y SoftBank para construir 5 nuevos centros de datos Stargate.

excerpt_i18n.en: The new sites will boost Stargate’s planned capacity to nearly 7 gigawatts—about equal to the output of seven large nuclear reactors.
excerpt_i18n.zh: 新站点将使星门的规划产能提升至近7吉瓦，约等于七座大型核反应堆的发电量。
excerpt_i18n.es: Los nuevos emplazamientos aumentarán la capacidad prevista de Stargate a casi 7 gigavatios, aproximadamente equivalente a la producción de siete grandes reactores nucleares.

items.title: Show HN: RapidFire AI: 16–24x More Experiment Throughput Without Extra GPUs
items.raw_excerpt: We built RapidFire AI, an open-source Python tool to speed up LLM fine-tuning and post-training with a powerful level of control not found in most tools: Stop, resume, clone-modify and warm-start configs on the fly—so you can branch experiments while they’re running instead of starting from scratch or running one after another. - Works within your OSS stack: PyTorch, HuggingFace TRL/PEFT), MLflow. - Hyperparallel search: launch as many configs as you want together, even on a single GPU - Dynamic real-time control: stop laggards, resume them later to revisit, branch promising configs in flight. - Deterministic eval + run tracking: Metrics curves are automatically plotted and are comparable. - Apache License v2.0: No vendor lock in. Develop on your IDE, launch from CLI. Repo: https://github.

title_i18n.en: Show HN: RapidFire AI: 16–24x More Experiment Throughput Without Extra GPUs
title_i18n.zh: HN展示：RapidFire AI：无需额外GPU即可实现16至24倍实验吞吐量提升
title_i18n.es: Mostrar HN: RapidFire AI: 16–24 veces Más Capacidad de Experimentación Sin GPUs Adicionales

excerpt_i18n.en: We built RapidFire AI, an open-source Python tool to speed up LLM fine-tuning and post-training with a powerful level of control not found in most tools: Stop, resume, clone-modify and warm-start configs on the fly—so you can branch experiments while they’re running instead of starting from scratch or running one after another. - Works within your OSS stack: PyTorch, HuggingFace TRL/PEFT), MLflow. - Hyperparallel search: launch as many configs as you want together, even on a single GPU - Dynamic real-time control: stop laggards, resume them later to revisit, branch promising configs in flight. - Deterministic eval + run tracking: Metrics curves are automatically plotted and are comparable. - Apache License v2.0: No vendor lock in. Develop on your IDE, launch from CLI. Repo: https://github.
excerpt_i18n.zh: 我们开发了RapidFire AI，这是一款开源Python工具，旨在加速LLM微调与训练后优化。它提供大多数工具不具备的强力控制功能：可实时停止、恢复、克隆修改及热启动配置——让您
excerpt_i18n.es: Desarrollamos RapidFire AI, una herramienta de código abierto en Python para acelerar el ajuste fino y el post-entrenamiento de LLM con un potente nivel de control no presente en la mayoría de herramientas: parar, reanudar, clonar-modificar y configuraciones de inicio en caliente sobre la marcha, para que

items.title: Running deep research AI agents on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore

The challenge, however, is not just building such agents but […]

items.title: Google’s Mixboard is an AI moodboard builder

The experimental tool is available through public beta in the US. The […]

items.title: Show HN: I built an AI in 3 days at 16 y/o that lets you chat with your PDFs
items.raw_excerpt: Hey, it's Safwan I'm 16 and obsessed with AI and coding. Last year, I was struggling with my homework - especially when teachers gave us long PDF documents to analyze for history and literature classes. The problem? I'd spend hours scrolling through 30-page PDFs trying to find specific quotes or information for my essays. My friends had the same issue - we were all wasting time instead of actually learning. I tried Ctrl+F, highlighting, even printing everything out... but I realized what we really needed was to ask questions to our documents like we would to a teacher. So during summer break, I taught myself more about AI and built the first version of PDF Chat. Now I can finish my research in minutes instead of hours, and I'm helping students and professionals worldwide do the same. Prett

title_i18n.es: Mostrando en HN: Construí una IA en 3 días a los 16 años que te permite chatear con tus PDFs

excerpt_i18n.en: Hey, it's Safwan I'm 16 and obsessed with AI and coding. Last year, I was struggling with my homework - especially when teachers gave us long PDF documents to analyze for history and literature classes. The problem? I'd spend hours scrolling through 30-page PDFs trying to find specific quotes or information for my essays. My friends had the same issue - we were all wasting time instead of actually learning. I tried Ctrl+F, highlighting, even printing everything out... but I realized what we really needed was to ask questions to our documents like we would to a teacher. So during summer break, I taught myself more about AI and built the first version of PDF Chat. Now I can finish my research in minutes instead of hours, and I'm helping students and professionals worldwide do the same. Prett

items.title: Integrate tokenization with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails for secure data handling
items.raw_excerpt: In this post, we show you how to integrate Amazon Bedrock Guardrails with third-party tokenization services to protect sensitive data while maintaining data reversibility. By combining these technologies, organizations can implement stronger privacy controls while preserving the functionality of their generative AI applications and related systems.

title_i18n.en: Integrate tokenization with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails for secure data handling

title_i18n.es: Integrar la tokenización con Amazon Bedrock Guardrails para el manejo seguro de datos
